meanings.definition: A concluding section of a literary work, often providing closure or summarizing the main points.
meanings.sent1: The epilogue of the story tied up all loose ends nicely.
meanings.sent2: After the final chapter, the epilogue gave a glimpse into the characters' future.
meanings.sent3: The epilogue humorously revealed what happened to the characters after the story ended.
meanings.sent4: The epilogue acted like a bow on a present, neatly wrapping up the tale.
meanings.sent5: The epilogue left a lasting impression on the readers, bringing the story to a satisfying close.

meanings.definition: A short speech or piece of writing at the end of a play or book.
meanings.sent1: In the epilogue, the actor thanked the audience for their support.
meanings.sent2: The epilogue of the play summarized the moral lessons learned by the characters.
meanings.sent3: The epilogue playfully broke the fourth wall, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The epilogue whispered the final secrets of the story to the attentive listeners.
meanings.sent5: The epilogue echoed through the theater, leaving a lasting impact on the viewers.
